result.execSummary:
The defendant Jean L Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of Conviction - Extends probation for one year 11/22/2019 - 11/22/2020 or until all financial obligations are paid in full

9:04 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Agent Katie Raymond present in court via telephone.  Court questions defendant regarding incarceration.  Statement by defendant - waiting on a bed for an ATR.  Court goes over obligations not paid.  Statement by Agent Raymond - no update at this time.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time. 

Court adjourned at 9:07 a.m.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (11/22/2019)

2:17 p.m.  Defendant present in court via telephone without counsel.  Agent Andrea Wilcox present in court via telephone.  Statement by the Court regarding request for extension.  Statement by defendant, has been incarcerated.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 2:19 p.m.

Defendant called and was released from custody on Saturday, October 13, 2018.  She has no ride to court.  Her grandfather is her only ride and he has a doctor appointment in Oshkosh this afternoon.  Defendant will be appearing with her agent via telephone this afternoon.

Case 2015CM278 COURT finds Defendant gulity. Sentence withheld. Orders 24 months probation, $100 fine plus court costs, $10.63 restitution, and DNA sample.

Case 2016CM14 COURT finds Defendant guilty. Sentence withheld. Orders 2 years probation, court costs, $318.83 restitution, and DNA sample.

Case 2016CM80 COURT Dismisses count 1 but read in. Finds Defendant guilty on count 2. Sentence withheld. Orders 24 months probation, no contact with JT Sentry Foods, court costs, $20.75 restitution, 25 hours community service, and DNA sample. 

Case 2016CM172 COURT finds Defendant guilty Count 1. Sentence withheld. Orders 24 months probation, court costs, DNA sample, and 10 days jail with huber as a condition of probation-may be served consecutive or must report December 23, 2016.

Count 2 Court finds Defendant guilty. Sentence withheld. Orders 24 months probation, court costs, no contact with JT Sentry Foods, $20.75 restitution, 25 hours community service, and DNA sample.
